full.title: Case Report: CD8+ T-Lymphocyte Deficit: A Prerequisite for Pasteurella spp. Infection?
full.authorString: Denes E, Fiorenza F, Armendariz M, Martin C.

authorAffiliation.affiliation: Infectious Diseases Department, ELSAN Polyclinique de Limoges, Limoges, France.
Orthopaedic Surgery Department, Limoges Teaching Hospital, Limoges, France.
Orthopaedic Surgery Department, Limoges Teaching Hospital, Limoges, France.
Bacteriology Laboratory, Limoges Teaching Hospital, Limoges, France.

full.abstractText: Background: Immunity against Pasteurella spp. is not well-known for humans. Methods: We've tested T CD8+ lymphocytes in a patient with a chronic prosthetic joint infection due to Pasteurella spp. to search for a deficit which could have favored her infection. As this deficit was found, we've searched for such a deficit in other patients with Pasteurella spp. Infections, either acute or subacute. Results: Eight patients were tested and all had a persistent T CD8+ lymphocytes deficit. This is striking as these cells are involved in the response to this type of infection in animal models. Conclusion: The authors suggest that a deficit in CD8+ T lymphocytes can be one of the causes for the onset of infections with P. multocida.
full.affiliation: Infectious Diseases Department, ELSAN Polyclinique de Limoges, Limoges, France.

abstract: Background: Immunity against Pasteurella spp. is not well-known for humans. As this deficit was found, we've searched for such a deficit in other patients with Pasteurella spp. Infections, either acute or subacute. Results: Eight patients were tested and all had a persistent T CD8+ lymphocytes deficit. This is striking as these cells are involved in the response to this type of infection in animal models. Conclusion: The authors suggest that a deficit in CD8+ T lymphocytes can be one of the causes for the onset of infections with P. multocida.
title: Case Report: CD8+ T-Lymphocyte Deficit: A Prerequisite for Pasteurella spp. Infection?
